page.title: 20Customs and Legends
page.content: Loughton does not have many legends. There is one about Dick Turpin and one about Boudicea. They say that the ghost of{Dick Turpin}still rides up York Hill or Pump Hill.{Boudicea}was queen of the Ancient Britons and it is said that she hid from the Romans at Loughton Camp. On Thursday the shops are closed for half a day. The customs in Loughton are few, but one that is becoming established is{Loughton Day}when people have fun around the town. On Remembrance Day we remember people from the wars. Loughton has lots of {fetes}organised by the scouts, guides and churches. The churches also have flower festivals. In the forest there are cold spots where people don't go because it sends a shiver down their spines.
